page.title: 15THE BURIAL MOUND
page.content: AS THE DIGGING FOR THE COUNCIL HOUSES WAS BEGUN IN 1974,THE WORKMEN FOUND MORE THAN THEY BARGAINED FOR. THEY DISCOVERED THE REMAINS OF A BURIAL MOUND. THE BURIAL MOUND IN SHIELDAIG WAS MADE IN THE LATE BRONZE_EARLY IRON AGE. THIS WAS A MOUND OF EARTH WITH A PASSAGE DOWN TO WHERE THE PEOPLE WERE BURIED.THEY WERE CREMATED.A TEAM OF ARCHEOLOGISTS FROM EDINBURGH UNCOVERED THE BURIAL GROUND AND FOUND THE ASHES AND FRAGMENTS OF BONE,WHICH THEY ANALYSED. THERE WERE BONES OF ABOUT THREE MEN. THE BURIAL SITE IS NOW COVERED BY THE PARKING PLACE FOR THE COUNCIL HOUSES. NOTHING IS LEFT TO SHOW IT WAS THERE, BUT THE GAELIC NAME FOR THAT PLACE IS REAN-A CHLAIDH, MEANING 'BURIAL PLACE'.
